definition: (of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student

sentences.english: The part-time boy is leafleting to the people passing by.
sentences.chinese: 那個工讀生正向路過的人發傳單。

sentences.english: Presently, there are few studies on bullying behavior of Gong-du students.
sentences.chinese: 目前對於工讀學校學生欺負行爲的研究還不多見。

sentences.english: I don't believe one more paycheck( to one more part-time worker) will bring down the business.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得多請一個工讀生就會讓餐廳的生意倒閉。

sentences.english: Are there any Chinese where you're now studying and working?
sentences.chinese: 你現在工讀的地方，有沒有中國人？

definition: to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off
to review a judicial case/to reexamine
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
a tax declaration form/a tax return
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
